body.name: VIZIO 32-inch D-Series Full HD 1080p Smart TV with Apple AirPlay and Chromecast Built-in, Alexa Compatibility, D32fM-K01, 2023 Model
features: Full HD Picture Perfection - Full HD Picture Perfection gives you crystal-clear, award-winning picture quality. Contrast and brightness are achieved with Full Array LED Backlight and fine-tuned at a granular level with Active Pixel Tuning. .Power Consumption : 28.89 W, Standby Power : <0.5W

America’s Smart TV - Instantly access millions of titles with America's Smart TV. Stream shows, movies, news, sports, music, and more on all your favorite apps, and enjoy over 250 free channels on WatchFree+.

VIZIO App Catalog - Your VIZIO TV includes an extensive App Catalog where new apps are automatically added and updated – no downloading needed. All the latest apps are instantly available and ready to discover.

Free TV Lives Here - Save on cable bills and stream for free with VIZIO WatchFree+. Built-in to every new VIZIO TV, WatchFree+ gives you 250+ live streaming channels and over 5,000 titles on demand. No subscriptions, logins, or fees.

Powerful Performance - The VIZIO D-Series has the horsepower for powerful performance. Superior picture processing, ultra-quick app navigation and reduced load times are powered by the IQ Picture Processor.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Full HD Picture Perfection. Contrast and brightness are achieved with Full Array LED Backlight and fine-tuned at a granular level with Active Pixel Tuning. Minimal Design. Maximum Entertainment. The modern 3-sided ThinFrame design fits beautifully in any room.

Stream it all. Access your favorite apps, cast from your phone, or watch hundreds of free channels. Free TV lives here. No fees, logins or subscriptions required. Hundreds of curated free streaming channels. We work with everyone. Use Alexa, Google Home, and Apple Home for voice control and smart home integration. Stream from your device. Stream it all and more or mirror your screen for presentations and video chats directly on your VIZIO Smart TV.
Previous page Next page 1 Bluetooth Pairing 2 VIZIO Voice 3 VIZIO Mobile

Game On - PC or Console Ready Get ready for next-gen gaming with AMD FreeSync, ultra-low input lag, VRR to reduce screen tearing, and NEW HDR gaming. Game Mode and the integrated gaming menu automatically power on when a console or PC is detected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Value with quality
reviews.reviewText: A smart tv with everything the expensive ones feature but at much lower cost. Easy assembly, light weight, reasonably good image quality except at extreme angles off axis, and pairs well with the sound bar. This is a great low cost feature laden alternative that is sure to please.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great For Truck Drivers!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this tv because my 2024 Freightliner Cascadia came with a tv mount and cable antenna, and this tv fits perfectly on the stock bracket! I bought tv mounting screws separately, and it has survived being on the road very well. It’s also really nice that this tv has an A/V Antenna port so I can use the truck’s antenna to watch cable tv. Otherwise, this tv is perfect for streaming from a phone’s personal hotspot, using an HDMI adapter to connect your phone directly, stream from a laptop, or play video games.This tv is very energy efficient as well, which is very important for being in a truck and powering it off the truck’s battery’s.The picture quality is also really good, and even though it’s 1080P it still has crystal clear quality.The tv also comes with a ton of apps that you can access, and it has Vizio Watch Free+.I would highly recommend this tv to other truck drivers due to it being light weight (about 6 lbs.), cable hookup, energy efficiency, and good quality. This also applies to RV’s as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very nice picture but sound is not commensurate
reviews.reviewText: This is a good quality tv that I purchased because of it's size. The 24" set fits nicely into smaller spaces. The picture is great, but the sound is not commensurate with the quality of the set. It has two tiny speakers that face out the back. No matter what adjustments are made, the sound is tinny and low-quality, like an old hand-held transistor radio from yesteryear. I had to purchase a Vizio sound bar and that fixed the sound problem while keeping the overall footprint small enough fit into the limited space I have for the set. I recommend this tv with the caveat that a sound bar is an absolute MUST for this tv. I gave this product 4 stars because without the sound bar, the sound is completely unacceptable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE IT! LOVE IT!! LOVE IT!!!
reviews.reviewText: This TV is EXCELLENT! It is nice and lightweight, super clear picture, EASY to learn how to operate it [I'm a senior citizen!], and GREAT price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great TV with ChromeCast and ApplePlay built in
reviews.reviewText: Thirds times a charm. I have ordered three tvs now from Amazon. The first wouldn't connect to the internet, the second had glitches in the screen, plus UPS charged me to send it back in the box it came in. Need to take that up with Amazon I guess. But this TV is really lovely. Very sleek looking and feels like quality. The TCL I tried felt like chinzy plastic crap. This Vizio was easy to set up and get my Prime Video hooked in no problem. Also worked using Chromecast from my PC and Apple Play from my phone. I wanted to be able to play exercise videos from my Silversneakers account. This is also the perfect size for my guesthouse. Plus it has a great picture. Sound could be louder. But I will try pairing my Sonos speaker with it. I am super pleased with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, so good
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a Smart TV to fit a small opening in my kitchen. Found this TV during Prime Day and this 24” fits perfectly.You will need an HDMI cord to connect to certain devices. I had extras so it wasn’t a problem for me, but definitely add that to your cart if needed.Some complained about the volume being low. After fiddling with the volume settings, I found that if the audio isn’t already set to Virtual X surround sound and volume leveling is set to off, turn it on and the volume increases significantly.The TV has great color under the bright setting.The best part is the microphone on the remote. Makes using the Smart system a breeze.Great value for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Terrible panel in this model, color is off even if adjusted.
reviews.reviewText: Pros:Sound is adequate.Works with ROKU.Other that that NONE.Cons:No mater how I adjust the color settings, including calibrating, the colors are way off, gray is light purple, white is even lighter purple, when set to warm everything is orange and green. Calibration is a royal pain the posterior, and is useless anyway as it only makes the colors worse.The picture for video is grainy and blurred at the same time, cloudy looking like having cataracts in your eyes, even with a ROKU.The remote is sparse, and the only shortcut buttons are for PAID services, also the home button takes you to a page of PAID movies and services not to the apps you chose to install which are buried in a side menu only accessible by pressing the left side of the D-Pad/Navigation Ring.The GUI is nothing but ads for PAID services at the top of everything making getting to the content you want tedious and messy.I tried all settings and calibrations to no avail all colors remained incorrect!The screen also looks washed out, blurred, and foggy, as well as being pixilated and grainy like a bad CRT TV from the 1980s.Absolutely useless as a PC monitor all text is illegible no matter what settings are in use.Whatever panel Vizio is using in these models it is totally inferior to the older models. I have an older model: D24F-F1 and it has a far superior panel in it than this new model, color is also correct and all text is just as good as it is on my monitor.Vizio also changed the location of the VESA mounting holes moving them 2 inches higher towards the top of the screen making it a mismatch on a dual screen stand, a major deal breaker for me.The selection of so called FREE viewing is pathetic and most of the apps available in the GUI are paid subscriptions only.Conclusion:This is the third brand of newer TV I’ve purchased in a months time, and all have been thoroughly disappointing! I will be returning this one as well and will probably go with a decent monitor of the same size and use an HDMI Hub to switch between a ROKU and a PC.
